explanation: This answer key summarises the foundational lessons about modelling problems, running instrumented experiments, and translating metrics into insight.

answerKey.rationale: The loop stresses modelling, transformation, measurement, and iteration; bypassing iteration contradicts the feedback cycle.
Ad-hoc brute force ignores scaling realities, so it fails when datasets grow.
MeasurementRecord collected timing samples for statistical summaries.
Randomised inputs stress caches and branches, revealing behaviour beyond best-case ordering.
The checksum verified frequency ordering consistency across experiments.
Measurements often surface new constraints, motivating another design pass.
Autocomplete, fraud detection, and robotics require predictable performance; the quarterly rendering scenario does not.
Metrics provide data; insights interpret the data to influence design decisions.
Intentional logging includes hypotheses, distributions, and reflective notes captured for future modules.
The lesson emphasises validating intuition through disciplined measurement.

keyPoints: Effective DSA practice pairs structural modelling with empirical measurement.
Instrumentation such as MeasurementRecord turns raw experiments into actionable summaries.
Reflecting on benchmarks before and after iteration keeps intuition grounded in evidence.
